content.raw: @{5b96b66385af94340e7cabce} , do we need to apply Rumman's changes to the tasks generated using the yaml files? Also, what about when we spawn the WAM-V using `gz` during the competition?
content.html: @Tyler Lum , do we need to apply Rumman's changes to the tasks generated using the yaml files? Also, what about when we spawn the WAM-V using gz during the competition?

content.raw: Our current infrastructure uses `sandisland.launch` for everything, but then we give it a different world file depending on the competition. Eg. `sandisland.launch world:=<competition_world>`. In this way, I don’t think any changes are needed there
content.html: Our current infrastructure uses sandisland.launch for everything, but then we give it a different world file depending on the competition. Eg. sandisland.launch world:=<competition_world>. In this way, I don’t think any changes are needed there

content.raw: I will check about spawning by `gz`
content.html: I will check about spawning by gz

content.raw: Thanks! I just want to make sure that we’re not forgetting anything.
content.html: Thanks! I just want to make sure that we’re not forgetting anything.

content.raw:
Here is the relevant code for spawning with gz. Would this just require changing --model-name=$model to --model-name=$namespace/$model?  Or will this not change the ros topic naming appropriately?

```
# If input urdf is a xacro file, convert xacro to a urdf file
final_urdf=/tmp/my_urdf.urdf
rosrun xacro xacro --inorder -o $final_urdf $urdf

# Spawn model
gz model --model-name=$model --spawn-file=$final_urdf -x $x -y $y -z $z -R $R -P $P -Y $Y
```
content.html:
Here is the relevant code for spawning with gz. Would this just require changing --model-name=$model to --model-name=$namespace/$model? Or will this not change the ros topic naming appropriately?

# If input urdf is a xacro file, convert xacro to a urdf file
final_urdf=/tmp/my_urdf.urdf
rosrun xacro xacro --inorder -o $final_urdf $urdf

# Spawn model
gz model --model-name=$model --spawn-file=$final_urdf -x $x -y $y -z $z -R $R -P $P -Y $Y

content.raw: I suspect that we’ll need the namespace there but could you try it out?
content.html: I suspect that we’ll need the namespace there but could you try it out?

content.html: I am trying it out now.

content.raw:
I was able to resolve the world issue by commenting out the changes like so. This should be resolved in another PR

```
diff -r 6a3fbf97e42a vrx_gazebo/worlds/xacros/include_all_xacros.xacro
--- a/vrx_gazebo/worlds/xacros/include_all_xacros.xacro Wed Aug 21 13:49:58 2019 -0600
+++ b/vrx_gazebo/worlds/xacros/include_all_xacros.xacro Wed Aug 21 14:25:51 2019 -0700
@@ -5,11 +5,11 @@
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/sandisland_minus_scene.xacro" />
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/scene.xacro" />
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/nav_challenge.xacro" />
-    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/light_buoy.xacro" />
+    <!-- <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/light_buoy.xacro" />
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/qualifying_pinger_transit_2016.xacro" />
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/dock_2016.xacro" />
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/dock_2018.xacro" />
-    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/scene_macro.xacro" />
+    <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/scene_macro.xacro" /> -->
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/usv_wind_plugin.xacro" />
     <xacro:include filename="$(find wave_gazebo)/world_models/ocean_waves/model.xacro"/>
     <xacro:include filename="$(find vrx_gazebo)/worlds/xacros/perception.xacro" />
```

Unfortunately, I could not get the namespace working with the spawn using `gz`. I tried the following:

```
diff -r 6a3fbf97e42a vrx_gazebo/launch/sandisland.launch
--- a/vrx_gazebo/launch/sandisland.launch       Wed Aug 21 13:49:58 2019 -0600
+++ b/vrx_gazebo/launch/sandisland.launch       Wed Aug 21 14:25:51 2019 -0700
@@ -52,7 +52,7 @@

   <!-- Load robot model -->
   <arg name="urdf" default="$(find wamv_gazebo)/urdf/wamv_gazebo.urdf.xacro"/>
-  <param name="robot_description"
+  <param name="wamv/robot_description"
          command="$(find xacro)/xacro --inorder '$(arg urdf)'
          thruster_config:=$(arg thrust_config)
          camera_enabled:=$(arg camera_enabled)
@@ -65,9 +65,9 @@
   <node name="spawn_model" pkg="gazebo_ros" type="spawn_model" if="$(arg non_competition_mode)"
         args="-x $(arg x) -y $(arg y) -z $(arg z)
               -R $(arg R) -P $(arg P) -Y $(arg Y)
-              -urdf -param robot_description -model wamv"/>
+              -urdf -param wamv/robot_description -model wamv -robot_namespace wamv"/>

-  <node name="spawn_wamv" pkg="vrx_gazebo" type="spawn_wamv.bash" unless="$(arg non_competition_mode)"
+  <node ns="wamv" name="spawn_wamv" pkg="vrx_gazebo" type="spawn_wamv.bash" unless="$(arg non_competition_mode)"
         args="-x $(arg x) -y $(arg y) -z $(arg z)
               -R $(arg R) -P $(arg P) -Y $(arg Y)
               --urdf $(arg urdf) --model wamv"/>
```

I tried either:

1. Adding `ns="wamv"` to the node that calls spawn\_wamv.bash
2. Adding `<group ns="wamv">...</group>` around the node
3. Looking for parameters to set the namespace from `gz model`, to no success \(eg. -n does not work\)

I believe this is a missing feature in gazebo. I cannot get the `/wamv` namespace at the beginning of the rostopics associated with the wamv through this. What do you think about this?

‌

`mkdir -p ~/my_worlds/world_xacros` `mkdir -p ~/my_worlds/worlds` `roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_worlds.launch requested:=$HOME/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/worlds/yamls/dock_shallow.yaml world_xacro_target:=$HOME/my_worlds/world_xacros/ world_target:=$HOME/my_worlds/worlds/` `roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_wamv.launch wamv_target:=$HOME/my_urdf_3.urdf` 

Then compare: 

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo dock.launch`

```
➜  vrx_ws rostopic list
/wamv/joint_states
/wamv/sensors/cameras/far_left_camera/camera_info
(etc.)
```

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch world:=$HOME/my_worlds/worlds/dock_shallow0.world urdf:=$HOME/my_urdf_3.urdf non_competition_mode:=false`   

```
➜  vrx_ws rostopic list
/joint_states
/sensors/cameras/far_left_camera/camera_info
(etc.)
```

With the above changes, I get `roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch world:=$HOME/my_worlds/worlds/dock_shallow0.world urdf:=$HOME/my_urdf_3.urdf ` working easily, but trying to use `gz`, I could not

content.raw: For the purpose of real competition, I don’t think it should matter, as it will be the server-side that creates the simulation \+ namespaces of the WAM-V. There should only be one wamv for competition, so teams can find the correct topic. However, it would be much nicer if we could get this working. We also could consider spawning the wamv in a different way.
content.html: For the purpose of real competition, I don’t think it should matter, as it will be the server-side that creates the simulation + namespaces of the WAM-V. There should only be one wamv for competition, so teams can find the correct topic. However, it would be much nicer if we could get this working. We also could consider spawning the wamv in a different way.

content.raw: I did a pass and fixed a few things but I’m a bit confused about the cases that still don’t work. Tyler, could you summarize what’s not working at this point? Thanks!
content.html: I did a pass and fixed a few things but I’m a bit confused about the cases that still don’t work. Tyler, could you summarize what’s not working at this point? Thanks!

content.raw:
Yes. The issue is that I haven't been able to give the `/wamv` namespace to the WAM-V sensors and thrusters when spawning using `gz`. Using `roslaunch vrx_gazebo dock.launch` works as expected with the `/wamv` namespace. However, using `roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch world:=<path to dock world> non_competition_mode:=false`, this spawns using `gz` and I was unable to get put it under that namespace.

I have tried: 

1. Adding `ns="wamv"` to the node that calls spawn\_wamv.bash
2. Adding `<group ns="wamv">...</group>` around the node
3. Looking for parameters to set the namespace from `gz model`, to no success \(eg. -n does not work\)

Is this an issue? Is there a better way to do this? Thanks
content.html:
Yes. The issue is that I haven't been able to give the /wamv namespace to the WAM-V sensors and thrusters when spawning using gz. Using roslaunch vrx_gazebo dock.launch works as expected with the /wamv namespace. However, using roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch world:=<path to dock world> non_competition_mode:=false, this spawns using gz and I was unable to get put it under that namespace.

I have tried:

  1. Adding ns="wamv" to the node that calls spawn_wamv.bash
  2. Adding <group ns="wamv">...</group> around the node
  3. Looking for parameters to set the namespace from gz model, to no success (eg. -n does not work)

Is this an issue? Is there a better way to do this? Thanks

content.raw: Here's another idea: How about modifying `wamv_gazebo_thruster_confix.xacro` and the sensor xacros to prefix `namespace` to the topic names. Maybe that change is enough.
content.html: Here's another idea: How about modifying wamv_gazebo_thruster_confix.xacro and the sensor xacros to prefix namespace to the topic names. Maybe that change is enough.

content.raw:
It works really well on almost every case. Only time I see an issue is when I run 

‌

```
➜  vrx_gazebo roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_wamv.launch wamv_target:=$HOME/my_urdf_3.urdf
➜  vrx_gazebo roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch urdf:=$HOME/my_urdf_3.urdf
```

The thrusters are not in the right ns. This is very fixable, but I need to check where. Maybe because it runs xacro in the python script when generating wamv, but didn’t get the namespace change yet.

```
➜  vrx_ws rostopic list
/clock
/gazebo/link_states
/gazebo/model_states
/gazebo/parameter_descriptions

/gazebo/set_model_state
/joint_states
/rosout
/rosout_agg
/thrusters/left_thrust_angle
/thrusters/left_thrust_cmd
/thrusters/right_thrust_angle
/thrusters/right_thrust_cmd
/vrx
/vrx/debug/wind/direction
/vrx/debug/wind/speed
/vrx/dock_2016_placard1/shuffle
```

content.html:
It works really well on almost every case. Only time I see an issue is when I run

‌

➜  vrx_gazebo roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_wamv.launch wamv_target:=$HOME/my_urdf_3.urdf
➜  vrx_gazebo roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch urdf:=$HOME/my_urdf_3.urdf

The thrusters are not in the right ns. This is very fixable, but I need to check where. Maybe because it runs xacro in the python script when generating wamv, but didn’t get the namespace change yet.
